intro: Guatteria multivenia, commonly known as the red-berried evergreen, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Annonaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically red when ripe, containing a single seed. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
